application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Demolition of existing garage and kitchen and the erection of a two storey end of terrace house and associated works
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the two-storey one bedroom house hereby approved shall match those used in the existing building at 1 St Johns Road.

Condition : 3 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (DK/DP/1061/01 Rev B, DK/DP/106/02, DK/DP/1061/06, Arboricultural Appraisal Report (Ref: DEV200820-562), prepared by MWA Arboriculture Ltd [dated 20 November 2020], Flood Risk Assessment, Unnumbered Location Plan, received on 04/01/2021; 1061/20 Rev A, received on 11/01/2021; DK/DP/PLG/1061/04 Rev B & DK/DP/1061/07 Rev A, received on 04/03/2021; Energy Statement, prepared by Green Heat Ltd [dated 9 March 2021], SAP Calculations (Optional-Nett Zero), SAP Calculations (Notional-Lean), SAP Calculations (Notional-Baseline), SAP Calculations (Notional-Clean), Predicted Energy Assessment (rating 79-82), Predicted Energy Assessment (rating 82-85), Predicted Energy Assessment (rating 83-86), Predicted Energy Assessment (rating 101-103) & Parking Report [dated 16 December 2020], received on 09/03/2021; DK/DP/PLG/1061/03 Rev E, received on 10/03/2021) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 4 - The arrangements for storing waste and recycled materials shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with this approval and shall be completed before any part of the accommodation hereby permitted is occupied and thereafter retained as such.

Condition : 5 - Prior to first occupation of the two-storey end-terraced house hereby approved a detailed plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected along the front, side and rear of the existing and proposed houses shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The boundary treatment shall be completed before the house is occupied or in accordance with a timetable agreed in writing with the local planning authority. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 6 - The front, side and rear gardens shall be divided as shown on the plan drawing numbered DK/DP/PLG/1061/03 Rev E and thereafter maintained as such for the duration of the development hereby permitted.

Condition : 7 - The two-storey end-terraced house shall not be occupied until space has been laid out within the site in accordance with approved plan no. DK/DP/PLG/1061/03 Rev E for at least two bicycles to be parked and that space shall thereafter be kept available for the parking of bicycles.

Condition : 8 - Before the two-storey end-terraced house hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, a visibility splay of 2.4 metres x 2.4 metres shall be provided on each side of the vehicular access (the depth measured from the back of the footway and the widths outwards from the edges of the access). Thereafter, no fence, wall or other obstruction to visibility exceeding 0.6 metres in height above the surface of the adjoining highway shall be erected, planted or allowed to grow within the areas of such splays.

Condition : 9 - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use, the redundant section of vehicular access to St Johns Road shall be permanently closed and full-height kerbs and footway reinstated so that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement.

Condition : 10 - The two-storey end-terraced house shall not be implemented other than in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and shall not commence above ground until full Design Stage calculations under the Standard Assessment Procedure and a detailed roof layout demonstrating that the roof's potential for a solar photovoltaic installation has been maximised have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 11 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions.

Condition : 12 - The development shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the following:

"	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.

"	At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.

"	No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 13 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (schedule of fittings and manufactures literature) should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105L/person/day or less.

Condition : 14 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 2015 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order) no enlargement of the of the hereby approved two-storey end-terraced house as shown on drawing Nos. DK/DP/PLG/1061/03 Rev E, DK/DP/PLG/1061/04 Rev B & DK/DP/PLG/1061/07 Rev A or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of its site shall be carried out.
Condition : 15 - The windows formed in the side elevation (south -western) shall be obscure glazed, hinged to open inwards and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.
